criterion: Digoxin for heart failure with normal systolic ventricular function
Digoxin for left systolic ventricular dysfunction where key interventions not tried
rationale: Beta-blockers and ACEIs should be tried first

criterion: Thiazide diuretic with hypokalaemia, hyponatraemia, hypercalcaemia or gout
condition: K+ <3.0 mmol/L, Na+ <130 mmol/L, Ca2+ >2.65 mmol/L, or gout
rationale: Can precipitate or worsen these conditions

criterion: Loop diuretic for dependent ankle oedema without heart/liver/renal failure
Aldosterone antagonists with K-sparing drugs without monitoring
action: STOP or monitor K+ every 6 months

criterion: Verapamil or diltiazem with heart failure
Nicorandil with ulceration (GI, skin, mucosa, eyes)
rationale: Nicorandil causes ulcers that don't respond to treatment
Limited evidence of benefit, increased risk
Less well tolerated by elderly than other classes

criterion: Amiodarone as first-line antiarrhythmic in SVT
rationale: Higher risk of side-effects than beta-blockers, digoxin, CCBs

criterion: Non-selective beta-blocker with bradycardia, heart block, heart failure, or asthma
condition: Bradycardia, heart block, uncontrolled HF, or asthma
rationale: Risk of worsening condition or bronchospasm
Increased bleeding risk, no evidence of increased efficacy

criterion: Aspirin with history of PUD without PPI
Aspirin as monotherapy for stroke prevention in AF

condition: Uncontrolled severe HTN, bleeding diathesis, recent bleeding

criterion: Aspirin + clopidogrel for secondary stroke prevention
rationale: No evidence of added benefit over clopidogrel alone

criterion: Antiplatelet + warfarin/NOAC in stable vascular disease
rationale: No added benefit from dual therapy

criterion: Warfarin/NOAC for DVT >6 months without ongoing risk
rationale: No proven added benefit beyond 6 months

criterion: Warfarin/NOAC for PE >12 months without ongoing risk
rationale: No proven added benefit beyond 12 months

criterion: TCAs with prostatism or urinary retention

rationale: Risk of exacerbation of respiratory failure

criterion: Benzodiazepines if fallen in past 3 months

rationale: Risk of sedation, confusion, falls, withdrawal syndrome
Risk of confusion, hypotension, extrapyramidal effects, falls

criterion: Antipsychotics long-term with Parkinsonism/Lewy Body (>1 month)
Antipsychotics if fallen in past 3 months

action: STOP unless symptoms severe and non-pharm failed

criterion: Levodopa/dopamine agonists for benign essential tremor

rationale: Sedative, significant anticholinergic toxicity in elderly
Risk of exacerbation of cognitive impairment

criterion: SSRIs with history of significant hyponatraemia

condition: QT prolongation or drugs that prolong QT

rationale: Risk of sedation and anticholinergic effects

criterion: Strong opioids as first-line for mild-moderate pain
Regular opioids >2 weeks with chronic constipation without laxatives

rationale: Risk of drowsiness, postural hypotension, vertigo

criterion: Slow-release opioids without short-acting for breakthrough
rationale: Risk of persistence of severe pain

criterion: Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors with bradycardia, heart block, syncope
condition: Bradycardia <60bpm, heart block, syncope, or drugs that reduce HR
rationale: Risk of cardiac conduction failure, syncope, injury

criterion: Domperidone with serious heart conditions or QT drugs
condition: Heart conditions, QT-prolonging drugs, CYP3A4 inhibitors

criterion: PPI at full dose >8 weeks for uncomplicated PUD
action: STOP full dose - reduce or PRN

criterion: Drugs causing constipation with chronic constipation
drug_class: Anticholinergics, oral iron, opioids, verapamil, aluminium antacids
rationale: Risk of exacerbation when non-constipating alternatives available

criterion: Antimotility drugs with C. diff or severe infective gastroenteritis
condition: C. difficile, bloody diarrhoea, high fever

criterion: Antimuscarinic bronchodilators with glaucoma or bladder obstruction
condition: Narrow-angle glaucoma or bladder outflow obstruction
rationale: May exacerbate glaucoma or cause urinary retention
Safer, more effective alternatives; narrow therapeutic index

criterion: Systemic corticosteroids instead of inhaled for COPD

rationale: Risk of exacerbation of heart failure

criterion: Oestrogens with breast cancer or VTE history
condition: History of breast cancer or venous thromboembolism

criterion: Oestrogen without progestogen with intact uterus

condition: Liver disease, oestrogen cancer, bleeding, thrombophilia, CVD

rationale: Risk of toxicity, no proven benefit
Consider drug holiday after discussing risks/benefits

condition: Unexplained thigh, hip, or groin pain

criterion: Oral bisphosphonates with upper GI disease
condition: Dysphagia, oesophagitis, gastritis, PUD, GI bleeding
rationale: Risk of relapse/exacerbation of oesophagitis or ulcers

condition: Unable to have regular dental checkups

criterion: Alpha-blockers with orthostatic hypotension or syncope
condition: Symptomatic orthostatic hypotension or micturition syncope

rationale: Risk of acute exacerbation of glaucoma

criterion: PDE-5 inhibitors with severe heart failure or nitrates
condition: Severe HF (SBP <90) or concurrent nitrate therapy
History of peptic ulcer or GI bleeding

rationale: Risk of exacerbation of heart failure

criterion: NSAID long-term >3 months without trial of simple analgesics
rationale: Simple analgesia/topical NSAID may be as effective
Risk of deterioration in renal function
Allopurinol is first choice for prophylaxis

criterion: Long-term corticosteroids as monotherapy for RA
Quinine without trial break every 3 months

condition: Bradycardia, heart block, uncontrolled HF, or asthma
rationale: Risk of bronchospasm or cardiac complications
